questions.text: Which of the following is transmitted by walking barefoot in soil?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Madurella mycetomatis Mycetoma is a localized chronic infection caused by various species of fungi or actinomycetes and characterized by the formation of aggregates of the causative organisms (grains) within abscesses. Grains are discharged to the surface through draining sinuses. Mycetoma may be caused by various species of fungi (Eumycetoma) and aerobic actinomycetes(Actinomycetoma). The most common aetiological agents are Madurella mycetomatis , Fusarium , Madurella grisea ,Actinomadura madurae , Nocardia brasiliensis and Nocardia asteroides. Trauma is the inciting event for the entry of microorganism . The earliest stage is a firm , painless nodule which progresses to firm, painless papules and pustules which break down to form sinuses discharging granules. A tentative diagnosis sufficient to initiate treatment may be made on the basis of grain colour, texture and direct microscopy. Radiographs may show destructive changes in the underlying bone. Causative species can often be suggested by the color of the characteristic grains and hyphal size within the infected tissues but definitive diagnosis requires culture. Dapsone with streptomycin or rifampicin OR Co-trimoxazole+ Streptomycin or Rifampicin is the first line of treatment . (Actinomycetoma -Modified welsh regimen is used) For Eumycotic mycetoma various etiologic agents may respond differently to antifungal agents, so culture results are invaluable.(Itraconazole can be used) Amputation is necessary in far advanced cases.

Extraedge:

Diagnosis of organisms causing mycetoma based on colour of grains: Colour of grains Organism Madurella mycetomatis Black to brown Madurella Grisea Black to brown Actinomadura madurae White Nocardia asteroides White Nocardia brasiliensis White

questions.text: Which organism is not associated with urethritis in men?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Gardnerella vaginalis Gardnerella vaginalis causes Bacterial Vaginosis in females.

Highyeild:

The most common organisms causing urethritis in men are: Neisseria gonorrhoeae Chlamydial infection Mycoplasma genitalium Adeno virus Herpes simplex Candida Trichomonas vaginalis Ureaplasma urealyticum Irritation and trauma are non -infectious causes The most common symptom of urethritis is urethral discharge with dysuria and systemic features. A thick yellow greenish discharge would be typical of gonnorrhoea. Diagnosis A diagnosis of urethritis is typically established based on examination revealing evidence of any of the following Mucopurulent or purulent discharge from the urethral meatus Detection of 2 or more WBC s per oil immersion field from a gram stain of a urethral swab . Positive Leukocyte esterase and /or the presence of 10 or more WBC s per high power field of the first voided urine in the absence of UTI. Additional tests include Gram stain , KOH mount ,NAAT . Treatment of Uncomplicated gonococcal urethritis (CDC guidelines) include Inj Ceftriaxone 500 mg i.m single dose . If co-existing Chlamydial infection Oral Doxycycline 100 mg BD for 7 days. Alternative regimen for cephalosporin allergy -Gentamicin 240 mg i.m single dose + Azithromycin 2 g oral single dose.

Extraedge:

Gonococcal Non gonococcal Discharge Green to yellowish Copious mucopurulent discharge Investigations Microscopy shows Capsulated diplococci with neutrophils NAAT is used

options.label: B
options.text: Ulcers are seen over dorsum of the penis

options.label: C
options.text: More associated with Crohn's disease than ulcerative colitis

questions.correct_answer: B. Ulcers are seen over dorsum of the penis
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ulcers are seen over dorsum of the penis Behcet’s disease is a multisystem inflammatory disease of unknown aetiology , classified as a systemic vasculitis and as a neutrophilic dermatoses. It is characterized clinically by recurrent courses of oral aphthous ulcers , genital ulcers , skin lesions (papulopustules , Erythema nodosum ) and iridocyclitis. Recurrent oral apthous ulcers , recurrent genital ulcers ,skin manifestations , ocular lesions and arthritis are the most common clinical features. Pathergy test is positive The characteristic arthritis is a non-erosive ,asymmetrical , sterile , sero-negative arthritis . The condition is HLA B51 positive . Genital ulcers can occur over shaft of penis, scrotum , vagina and perianal regions. Oral and topical antibiotics and corticosteroids are used for treatment. In severe cases Anti-TNF agents cyclosporine and Azathioprine are used.

Extraedge:

Pathergy test is a nonspecific hypersensitivity skin reaction induced by needle prick that is exaggerated and more prominent than that seen in normal skin. It is also seen in Sweet’s syndrome Pyoderma gangrenosum Behcet’s disease.

questions.text: A 60-year-old female with great toe infection. She had a significant discoloration with a subungual hyperkeratosis that caused surface changes. She was suspected with onychomycosis. Which is the topical drug given in toe nail onychomycosis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Tavaborole Tavaborole is a topical agent used for the treatment of onychomycosis. It inhibits an essential fungal enzyme ,leucyl -tRNA synthetase that is required for protein synthesis. It was approved by FDA in 2014.

Highyeild:

Tinea Unguium or Onychomycosis is a trichophyton infection of one or more fingernails or toenails. Types : Distal and Lateral subungual Onychomycosis Superficial Onychomycosis Proximal subungual onychomycosis Endonyx Onychomycosis Totally Dystrophic Onychomycosis Mixed Onychomycosis The species most commonly found is T rubrum. The nails are lusterless, brittle, and hypertrophic, and the substance of the nail is friable. Portions of the nail should be clipped, digested with 10% KOH, and examined under the microscope for hyphae. Fungi may also be cultured from debris collected from underneath the nail plate. Periodic acid-Schiff stain of a histologic section of the nail plate will also demonstrate the fungus readily. Treatment: First line: Oral Terbinafine 250 mg /day for 6 weeks for finger nails , for 3 months for toe nails. Or Itraconazole 400 mg /day for 1 week , monthly for 2-3 months for fingernails , for 3-4 months for toe nails . Second line: Griseofulvin dose 1 g for 4-8 months (Longer for toe nails ) Topical ;Amorolfine , Ciclopirox olamine , Tavaborole and Tioconazole.

Extraedge:

Proximal subungual Onychomycosis is associated with HIV . Paronychia with or without Onychomycosis is caused by Candida, Fusarium and Neoscytalidum species.

questions.text: A gardener from Himachal Pradesh presents with nodulo-ulcerative lesions on upper limb. Axillary lymphadenopathy present and aspiration microscopy findings shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Sporotrichosis The clinical findings of nodulo-ulcerative lesions with “Cigar shaped” colonies are characteristic of Sporotrichosis.

Highyeild:

Sporotrichosis is an acute or chronic fungal infection caused by Sporothrix schenckii. In most of the cases the fungus is introduced into the skin or mucous membrane by trauma as in a minor puncture wound caused by a thorn or splinter . It is also called as “Rose gardener” disease . The two clinical variants of sporotrichosis is subcutaneous and systemic type. Subcutaneous type is divided into two types lymphangitic and fixed type. The first sign of the infection is dermal nodule and breaks into ulcer and a chain of soft secondary nodules develops along the course of lymphatics. Treatment includes oral itraconazole , terbinafine and potassium iodide. Saturated solution of potassium iodide 4-6 ml tid which is effective in cutaneous sporotrichosis and the daily dose is built up slowly from 1 ml tid over 2-3 weeks.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Incorrect ; Chromoblastomycosis is characterised by verrucous plaques with characteristic “Medlar bodies” on microscopy. Option: C. Incorrect ; Coccidiomycosis is characterised by multiple erythematous papules and nodules over body . Option: D. Incorrect ; Histoplasmosis is characterised by multiple papules nodules , abscess and ulcers.

Extraedge:

Histopathology shows a mixed granulomatous and pyogenic infection with oval or Cigar shaped yeasts with “Asteroid “ bodies.
